section.sectiontext: This regulation will be used to determine farm classification for assessment purposes for the 1998 and subsequent taxation years.

change.changenote: Section 3 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: The application for classification of land as a farm must be delivered to the assessor on or before October 31 in the form prescribed by the assessment authority.

change.changenote: Section 4 (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: Land will only be classed as farm where part of a parcel or parcels of land are

paragraph.paragraphtext: necessary to the farm, and
predominantly used for primary agricultural production.

change.changenote: Section 4 (2.1) was added by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.
Section 4 (3) and (3.1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), where land is part of a farm that lies within an agricultural land reserve designated under the Agricultural Land Commission Act and has no present use, the assessor must classify that land as a farm if

paragraph.paragraphtext: it is part of a parcel, a portion of which is used for primary agricultural production, and the portion used for the primary agricultural production makes a reasonable contribution to the farm operation,
the owner certifies on the prescribed form that the land is being held for the purpose of primary agricultural production, and
the parcel being used for primary agricultural production meets the other requirements of this regulation.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1), (2) and (3), the assessor must classify land as farm if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the land has no present use,
the land has a highest and best use that is a use not better than that of a farm,

the land is part of a parcel, a portion of which is used for primary agricultural production, and the portion used for the primary agricultural production makes a reasonable contribution to the farm operation, and
the portion being used for primary agricultural production meets the other requirements of this regulation.

change.changenote: Section 4 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

section.marginalnote: Classification of land as a farm

subsection.subsectiontext: Unless this regulation provides otherwise, the assessor must classify as farm all or part of a parcel of land used for

paragraph.paragraphtext: primary agricultural production,
a farmer's dwelling, or
the training and boarding of horses when operated in conjunction with horse rearing.

subsection.subsectiontext: Land will only be classed as farm where part of a parcel or parcels of land are

paragraph.paragraphtext: necessary to the farm, and
predominantly used for primary agricultural production.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the assessor must classify land as a farm if the land is used for purposes that contribute to primary agricultural production, including, without limitation, the following purposes:

paragraph.paragraphtext: drainage;
irrigation;
a riparian area;
a buffer;
a headland;
a windbreak;
seasonal feeding or calving grounds;
shelter for livestock;
farm outbuildings;
access to farm outbuildings or other land that is part of the farm operation.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the assessor must classify land as a farm if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the land is in an agricultural land reserve,
the land is part of a parcel, a portion of which is used for primary agricultural production,
the portion of the parcel being used for primary agricultural production makes a reasonable contribution to a farm operation and meets the other requirements of this regulation, and
the land

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: is used only for purposes ancillary to a farmer's dwelling, or
has no present use and is neither specifically zoned nor held for business, commercial or industrial purposes.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the assessor must classify land as a farm if the land is not in an agricultural land reserve and

paragraph.paragraphtext: the land

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: is used only for purposes ancillary to a farmer's dwelling, and

is part of a parcel, a portion of which is used for primary agricultural production, and the portion used for primary agricultural production makes a reasonable contribution to a farm operation and meets the other requirements of this regulation, or

paragraph.paragraphtext: the land has no present use, is neither specifically zoned nor held for business, commercial or industrial purposes and meets one of the following standards:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the land

clause.clausetext: has a highest and best use that is a use not better than that of a farm, and

is part of a parcel, a portion of which is used for primary agricultural production, and the portion used for primary agricultural production makes a reasonable contribution to a farm operation and meets the other requirements of this regulation;

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the land is part of a parcel, a portion of which, comprising 50% or more of the total area of the parcel that is outside the agricultural land reserve, is used for primary agricultural production or is used for purposes that contribute to primary agricultural production within the meaning of subsection (2.1), and that portion is farmed by the owner and meets the other requirements of this regulation;

the land is part of a parcel, a portion of which, comprising 25% or more of the total area of the parcel that is outside the agricultural land reserve, is used for primary agricultural production, and that portion is farmed by the owner and meets the other requirements of this regulation.

subsection.subsectiontext: A farm operation is comprised of all or part of a parcel or group of parcels of land

paragraph.paragraphtext: contiguous or not,
owned, or leased in accordance with section 7, and
operated as an integrated unit.

subsection.subsectiontext: A farm operation comprised of parcels of land within different assessment areas will only be classed as a farm where the assessor is satisfied that each parcel is

paragraph.paragraphtext: necessary to the farm, and
predominantly used for primary agricultural production.

change.changenote: Section 5 (2.1) was added by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.
Section 5 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the sale of primary agricultural products from the farm must occur during each 12 month period ending October 31.

change.changenote: Section 5 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 4, the classification of land as a farm requires the production of primary agricultural products on the farm by the owner or lessee in either the 12 month period ending October 31, or in the preceding 12 month period, having a gross annual value at farm gate prices of at least

paragraph.paragraphtext: $2 500 if the area of land is between 8 000 m2 and 4 ha,
$2 500 plus 5% of the actual value of the land for farm purposes in excess of 4 ha, if the area of land is more than 4 ha,
$10 000 if the total area of land is less than 8 000 m2, and
despite paragraph (c), $2 500 if the area of land has been reduced to less than 8 000 m2 as a result of expropriation but only if the land remains in the same ownership.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsection (1) (c), if land is classified as a farm in 1995 and if the gross value of production is less than $10 000, the land will continue to be classified as a farm so long as

paragraph.paragraphtext: the total area of the owned parcel or parcels is less than 8 000 m2,
the land remains in the same ownership,
the assessor is satisfied that the owner earns the greater part of his livelihood from the sale of primary agricultural products produced on the land, and
the land meets the other requirements of this regulation.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite subsections (1) and (2), the classification of land as a farm under section 4 (3.1) (b) (iii) requires the production of primary agricultural products on the farm by the owner in either the 12 month period ending October 31, or in the preceding 12 month period, having a gross annual value at farm gate prices of at least $10 000.
Despite subsections (1), (2) and (2.1), the sale of primary agricultural products from the farm must occur during each 12 month period ending October 31.
In determining the gross annual value, the assessor must

paragraph.paragraphtext: consider only the value of primary agricultural production which takes place on the farm, and
include any unrealized value of primary agricultural production grown or raised on the farm in the 12 month period ending October 31.

change.changenote: Section 6 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

section.marginalnote: Exception to requirement for sale of primary agricultural products
section.sectiontext: Despite section 5 (3), the assessor may classify land as farm if the primary agricultural production from the land is

paragraph.paragraphtext: not sold but is produced in sufficient quantities to have met the gross annual value requirements if it had been offered for sale, and
either

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: grains, oilseeds, fine seeds or pulse seeds, and the assessor is satisfied that the grains or seeds will be available for sale within 12 months after October 31, or

any other primary agricultural product that is grown and harvested for processing for sale or to be used in the preparation of manufactured derivatives to be made available for sale within 12 months after October 31.

change.changenote: Section 6.1 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: In exceptional circumstances, the Lieutenant Governor in Council may waive, by order, any of the sales or production requirements of this regulation for the period and on any terms and conditions specified in the order.

In this section, exceptional circumstances includes natural disasters and any other circumstances the Lieutenant Governor in Council is satisfied are of such a severity as to prevent or make impracticable compliance with certain sales or production requirements of this regulation.

change.changenote: Section 7 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: To be classed as a farm the leased land must

paragraph.paragraphtext: be either

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: used for primary agricultural production and make a reasonable contribution to the farm operation, or
certified by the owner, on the form prescribed for the purposes of section 4 (3) (b), as being held for the purpose of primary agricultural production, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: be 8 000 m2or greater except if

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the land is in the Agricultural Land Reserve (ALR), and
despite section 4 (3), the land is used for primary agricultural production.

change.changenote: Section 7 (3) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

paragraph.paragraphtext: make a reasonable contribution to the farm operation, and
be 8 000 m2 or greater except if

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 5 and section 7 (1), in the case of leases of Crown land issued after October 31, the assessor must classify all or part of the land as a farm if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the application form referred to in section 3 is delivered to the assessor on or before December 31, and
the assessor is satisfied that the farm meets the other requirements of this regulation.

change.changenote: Section 8 (1) (part) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 275/2009, effective November 27, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 5 (1), (2) and (3), the assessor must classify land not yet in production as a developing farm if the assessor is satisfied the land is being developed as a farm and the application form referred to in section 3 shows that on or before October 31 the following conditions will be met:

change.changenote: Section 8 BEFORE re-enacted by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.

subsection.subsectiontext: Despite section 5, the assessor must classify land not yet in production as a developing farm if the assessor is satisfied the land is being developed as a farm and the application form referred to in section 3 shows that on or before October 31 the following conditions will be met:

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of products produced from primary agricultural production that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: require less than one year after planting before harvesting occurs, there is a sufficient area prepared and planted to meet the requirements of this regulation on or before October 31 of the following year,
require 1 to 6 years to establish after planting before harvesting occurs, there is a sufficient area prepared and planted to meet the requirements of this regulation when harvesting occurs, and

require 7 to 12 years to establish after planting, there is a sufficient area prepared and planted to meet the requirements of this regulation when harvesting occurs and the assessor determines that there is a reasonable expectation of profit from farming,

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of livestock, poultry, greenhouse or mushroom operations that require 1 year to establish before sales occur,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the necessary buildings, structures and fencing are completed,
the required livestock and poultry are purchased and present, and
the assessor is satisfied that the farm will meet the requirements of this regulation on or before October 31 of the following year, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of aquaculture operations that require 2 years to establish before harvesting occurs,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the buildings and structures are completed as required to meet the minimum gross annual value level for the farm,
the land is seeded, planted or stocked as required to meet the requirements of section 5 when production and sales occur, and
the assessor is satisfied that the farm will meet the requirements of this regulation on or before October 31 of the year that production and sales occur.

subsection.subsectiontext: The owner or lessee must submit with the application form for approval by the assessor a development plan and site diagram which includes location and details of the crop to be planted, area, date of planting, expected yield, selling price and date of harvest.
Despite subsection (1) (a), the assessor must classify land as a developing farm if the following conditions are met:

paragraph.paragraphtext: the required area of land is prepared for planting on or before October 31,
the development plan shows that the crop will be planted by the spring of the year following application,
the assessor is satisfied that a viable farm will be established in accordance with the requirements for that crop based on sound agricultural practices, and
the developing farm will meet the requirements of this regulation when harvesting occurs.

subsection.subsectiontext: When the farm meets the gross annual value requirements of section 5 of this regulation, the farm will no longer be classified as a developing farm under this section.

section.subsandwich: For the purposes of farm classification under the Assessment Act, primary agricultural production is:
section.parasandwich: Christmas tree culture (plantation and cultured native stand)
Populus species and Salix species intensely cultivated in plantations
insects raised for biological pest control
the raising of crops or animals for food for human or animal consumption
wool, hide, feather or fur production

paragraph.paragraphtext: the production of manufactured derivatives from agricultural raw materials,
primary agricultural production for domestic consumption on the farm,
the production of agricultural by-products,
agricultural services, or
the breeding and raising of pets, except horses.

change.changenote: Schedule was enacted by BC Reg 138/2012, effective September 1, 2012.
Schedule BEFORE amended by BC Reg 135/2014, effective June 24, 2014.

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are agricultural uses for the purposes of paragraph (a) of the definition of "qualifying agricultural use" in section 1 (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Christmas tree culture (plantation and cultured native stand);
management of the following trees, for the production of sap or syrup:

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: trees botanically known as Betula species and commonly known as birch, or
trees botanically known as Acer species and commonly known as maple;
trees botanically known as Populus species and commonly known as poplar, or
trees botanically known as Salix species and commonly known as willow;

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: raising insects for biological pest control;
raising crops for food for human or animal consumption;

bcl:section.bcl:text: The following are excluded uses for the purposes of paragraph (b) of the definition of "qualifying agricultural use" in section 1 (1):

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: the production of manufactured derivatives from agricultural raw materials;
the production of qualifying agricultural products for domestic consumption on the farm;
the production of agricultural by-products other than breeding products;
agricultural services other than horse stud services;
the breeding and raising of pets other than horses.
